# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.f3c28646:
sns.lineplot(x='price', y='retail_price', data=data, style='uses_ad_boosts')
sns.set(style="whitegrid")
plt.show()
source.4f9e6d04:
sns.barplot(x='theme', y='price', data=data, color='green', hue='uses_ad_boosts', palette='rocket')
sns.set(style="whitegrid")
plt.show()
source.b1c26332:
sns.scatterplot(x='price', y='retail_price', data=data,  hue='uses_ad_boosts')
sns.set(style="whitegrid")
plt.show()
source.c5cf9d50:
sns.scatterplot(x='price', y='retail_price', data=data,  style='uses_ad_boosts')
sns.set(style="whitegrid")
plt.show()
source.001b108b:
sns.displot(x='retail_price', data=data, hue='uses_ad_boosts', palette='rocket')
sns.set(style="whitegrid")
plt.show()
source.91f00b3c:
sns.boxplot(x='price', y='theme', data=data, color='yellow', linewidth=3)
plt.show()
source.32b8b5c5:
sns.violinplot(x='price', y='theme', data=data, color='yellow', linewidth=3)
plt.show()
